Title.evidence: The aim of this multicentre pragmatic RCT was to compare re-excision and positive margin rates after localization using 125 I seed or hookwire in women with non-palpable breast cancer.

Trial_Design.evidence: Between September 2013 and March 2018, women with non-palpable breast cancer eligible for breast-conserving surgery were assigned randomly to preoperative localization using 125 I seeds or hookwires.

Participants.evidence: women with non-palpable breast cancer eligible for breast-conserving surgery were assigned randomly to preoperative localization using 125 I seeds or hookwires.

Intervention.evidence: women with non-palpable breast cancer eligible for breast-conserving surgery were assigned randomly to preoperative localization using 125 I seeds or hookwires.

Objective.evidence: The aim of this multicentre pragmatic RCT was to compare re-excision and positive margin rates after localization using 125 I seed or hookwire in women with non-palpable breast cancer.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Primary endpoints were rates of re-excision and margin positivity.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was stratified by lesion type (pure ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) or other) and study site.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 690 women were randomized at eight sites; 659 women remained after withdrawal ( 125 I seed, 327; HWL, 332).

Number_Analysed.evidence: 659 women remained after withdrawal ( 125 I seed, 327; HWL, 332).

Result_Outcome.evidence: The re-excision rate after 125 I seed localization was significantly lower than for HWL (13.9 versus 18.9 per cent respectively; P = 0.019).
